io.cettia.asity.http

Interface ServerHttpExchange

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractServerHttpExchange, AtmosphereServerHttpExchange, GrizzlyServerHttpExchange, NettyServerHttpExchange, ServletServerHttpExchange, VertxServerHttpExchange

    public interface ServerHttpExchange
    Represents a server-side HTTP request-response exchange.

    Implementations are not thread-safe.

    Author:
    Donghwan Kim
    See Also:
    RFC2616 - Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ServerHttpExchange end()
      Completes the response.
      ServerHttpExchange end(ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
      Writes a binary chunk to the response body and completes the response through end().
      ServerHttpExchange end(String data)
      Writes a text chunk to the response body using the charset from the response header, content-type and completes the response through end().
      ServerHttpExchange end(String data, String charsetName)
      Writes a text chunk to the response body using the given charset and completes the response through end().

      Returns the first request header associated with the given name.

      The names of the request headers.

      Returns the request headers associated with the given name or empty list if no header is found.

      The name of the request method.

      Attaches an action to be called with the whole request body.

      Attaches an action to be called with a chunk from the request body.
      ServerHttpExchange onclose(Action<Void> action)
      Attaches an action when the underlying connection is aborted for some reason like an error.
      ServerHttpExchange onend(Action<Void> action)
      Attaches an action to be called when the request is fully read.
      ServerHttpExchange onerror(Action<Throwable> action)
      Attaches an action to be called when this exchange gets an error.

      Attaches an action to be called when the response is fully written.

      Sets response headers.

      Sets a response header.

      Returns the provider-specific component.

      The request URI.

    • Method Detail

      • uri

        String uri()
        The request URI.

      • method

        HttpMethod method()
        The name of the request method.

      • headerNames

        Set<String> headerNames()
        The names of the request headers. HTTP header is not case-sensitive but Set is case-sensitive.

      • header

        String header(String name)
        Returns the first request header associated with the given name.

      • headers

        List<String> headers(String name)
        Returns the request headers associated with the given name or empty list if no header is found.

      • read

        ServerHttpExchange read()
        Reads the request body. If the request header, content-type, starts with text/, the body is read as text, and if not, as binary. In case of text body, the charset is also determined by the same header. If it's not given, ISO-8859-1 is used by default.

        The read data will be passed to event handlers as String if it's text and ByteBuffer if it's binary attached through onchunk(Action).

        This method should be called after adding onchunk(Action), onbody(Action), and onend(Action) and has no side effect if called more than once.

      • readAsText

        ServerHttpExchange readAsText()
        Reads the request body as text. The charset is determined by the request header, content-type. If it's not given, ISO-8859-1 is used by default.

        The read data will be passed to event handlers as String attached through onchunk(Action).

        This method should be called after adding onchunk(Action), onbody(Action), and onend(Action) and has no side effect if called more than once.

      • readAsText

        ServerHttpExchange readAsText(String charsetName)
        Reads the request body as text using the given charset.

        The read data will be passed to event handlers as String attached through onchunk(Action).

        This method should be called after adding onchunk(Action), onbody(Action), and onend(Action) and has no side effect if called more than once.

      • readAsBinary

        ServerHttpExchange readAsBinary()
        Reads the request body as binary.

        The read data will be passed to event handlers as ByteBuffer attached through onchunk(Action).

        This method should be called after adding onchunk(Action), onbody(Action), and onend(Action) and has no side effect if called more than once.

      • onchunk

        ServerHttpExchange onchunk(Action<?> action)
        Attaches an action to be called with a chunk from the request body. The allowed data type is String for text body and ByteBuffer for binary body.

      • onend

        ServerHttpExchange onend(Action<Void> action)
        Attaches an action to be called when the request is fully read. It's the end of the request.

      • onbody

        ServerHttpExchange onbody(Action<?> action)
        Attaches an action to be called with the whole request body. The allowed data type is String for text body and ByteBuffer for binary body. If the body is quite big, it may drain memory quickly. If that's the case, use onchunk(Action) and onend(Action).

      • setStatus

        ServerHttpExchange setStatus(HttpStatus status)
        Sets the HTTP status for the response.

      • setHeader

        ServerHttpExchange setHeader(String name,
                           String value)
        Sets a response header.

      • setHeader

        ServerHttpExchange setHeader(String name,
                           Iterable<String> value)
        Sets response headers.

      • write

        ServerHttpExchange write(String data)
        Writes a text chunk to the response body using the charset from the response header, content-type. If it's not given, ISO-8859-1 is used.

      • write

        ServerHttpExchange write(String data,
                       String charsetName)
        Writes a text chunk to the response body using the given charset.

      • write

        ServerHttpExchange write(ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Writes a binary chunk to the response body.

      • end

        ServerHttpExchange end()
        Completes the response. Each exchange's response must be finished with this method when done. It's the end of the response. This method has no side effect if called more than once.

      • end

        ServerHttpExchange end(String data)
        Writes a text chunk to the response body using the charset from the response header, content-type and completes the response through end().

      • end

        ServerHttpExchange end(String data,
                     String charsetName)
        Writes a text chunk to the response body using the given charset and completes the response through end().

      • end

        ServerHttpExchange end(ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Writes a binary chunk to the response body and completes the response through end().

      • onfinish

        ServerHttpExchange onfinish(Action<Void> action)
        Attaches an action to be called when the response is fully written. It's the end of the response.

      • onerror

        ServerHttpExchange onerror(Action<Throwable> action)
        Attaches an action to be called when this exchange gets an error. It may or may not accompany the closure of connection. Its exact behavior is platform-specific and error created by the platform is propagated.

      • onclose

        ServerHttpExchange onclose(Action<Void> action)
        Attaches an action when the underlying connection is aborted for some reason like an error. After this event, all the other event will be disabled.

      • unwrap

        <T> T unwrap(Class<T> clazz)
        Returns the provider-specific component.
